required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Individualized Diet Improvement Program (iDip) for Weight Loss and Maintenance.

brief_summary.textblock: This research is to develop a weight loss and weight maintenance program through dietary modifications for adults with obesity. Although scientific studies have shown the feasibility of rapid and safe dietary weight loss and subsequent weight maintenance, no efficacious dietary weight management program is widely available, and thus bariatric surgery remains the most reliable approach for weight loss/management. Safe and effective dietary weight loss and subsequent weight maintenance require flexible, individualized advice by an experienced dietitian/nutritionist.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline body weight at 6 months
Change from baseline body weight at 12 months
Change from baseline body weight at 18 months

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline waist circumference at 12 months
Change from baseline hip circumference at 12 months
Change from baseline protein intake at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Protein intake in grams and caloric intake will be combined to report density in g/100kcal

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline protein intake at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Protein intake in grams and caloric intake will be combined to report density in g/100kcal

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline fiber intake at 6 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fiber intake in grams and caloric intake will be combined to report density in g/100kcal

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline fiber intake at 12 months
secondary_outcome.description: Fiber intake in grams and caloric intake will be combined to report density in g/100kcal

arm_group.description: Eligible participants will be in an intervention group led by a registered dietitian

intervention.description: During a 12-month period, participants will attend a total of 22 diet improvement sessions, each of which will last approximately 1 hour. Twelve sessions will be held in the first 5 months and will be focused on safe and efficient weight loss. The participants will learn to create a personalized weight loss diet from their kitchen based on their diet practice and food preference. The next 10 sessions will be held in the last 7 months and will be focused on weight maintenance and healthy eating. The participants will build skills to select foods and create meals that prevent them from overeating.

patient_data.ipd_description: All individual participant data that underlie results in a publication will be shared.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be maintained for three years after completion of the study
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Findings will be disseminated via abstracts and presentations at scientific conferences and through manuscripts and journal articles within the field.
